definitions: capital city of Pakistan located in the northeastern part of the country
examples: The embassy is located in downtown Islamabad near government buildings
Many international organizations have their offices in Islamabad

definitions: political movement advocating for Islamic principles to guide public and political life
examples: The rise of Islamism shaped regional politics during the late twentieth century
Scholars debate different interpretations and forms of Islamism across various countries

definitions: person who supports or advocates for Islamic political ideology and governance
member of an organization promoting Islamic principles in politics
examples: The Islamist candidate promised to implement religious law if elected
Several Islamist groups participated in the democratic process peacefully
The party recruited young Islamist members through university networks
International observers monitored the Islamist movement's political activities closely

definitions: irrational fear, hatred, or discrimination against Islam and Muslims based on negative stereotypes
examples: The community organized workshops to combat Islamophobia through education and dialogue
Reports of Islamophobia increased after the controversial media coverage

definitions: member of a Shia Muslim community following the spiritual leadership of the Aga Khan
examples: The Ismaili community center offers educational programs for local youth
Many Ismaili traditions blend religious practice with modern social engagement

definitions: nation in the Middle East on the eastern Mediterranean coast established in 1948
examples: Israel shares borders with Lebanon, Syria, Jordan, and Egypt
The technology sector drives much of Israel's modern economy today

definitions: member of the ancient Hebrew people descended from Jacob according to biblical tradition
examples: Archaeological discoveries revealed how the Israelites lived in ancient times
The Israelite kingdoms played crucial roles in ancient Middle Eastern history

definitions: largest city in Turkey spanning Europe and Asia across the Bosphorus strait
examples: Istanbul served as capital for both Byzantine and Ottoman empires
Millions of tourists visit Istanbul to see its historic mosques annually

definitions: typeface style with letters slanted to the right for emphasis
member of ancient peoples who inhabited the Italian peninsula before Roman expansion
examples: The editor marked all book titles in italic throughout the manuscript
Please write foreign words in italic to distinguish them clearly
The Italic tribes influenced early Roman culture and language significantly
Archaeologists discovered Italic pottery dating from the fifth century BCE

definitions: nation in southern Europe shaped like a boot extending into the Mediterranean Sea
examples: Italy attracts millions with its art, cuisine, and historical sites
The Renaissance began in Italy during the fourteenth century period

definitions: acronym for John Fitzgerald Kennedy, the 35th President of the United States
major international airport serving New York City named after President Kennedy
examples: JFK delivered his famous inaugural address in January nineteen sixty-one
Many documentaries examine JFK's presidency and tragic assassination in Dallas
Our flight departs from JFK terminal four at eight tonight
The shuttle service runs between Manhattan and JFK every hour

definitions: mechanical device using leverage to lift heavy objects like vehicles
playing card ranking between ten and queen in standard decks
socket or plug for connecting electrical or audio equipment
common masculine given name often used as nickname for John
examples: Keep the jack in your trunk for emergency tire changes
The mechanic used a hydraulic jack to lift the car
She drew the jack of hearts from the shuffled deck
In this game, jacks rank higher than tens but below queens
Plug your headphones into the audio jack on the side
The guitar cable connects through a quarter-inch jack properly
Jack called to confirm tomorrow's meeting at three o'clock
My neighbor Jack helps with gardening every spring season

definitions: short repeated melodic phrase in popular music, especially rock or jazz
clever or amusing verbal improvisation on a particular topic or theme
examples: The guitarist played an unforgettable riff during the song's introduction
That bass riff drives the entire rhythm of the track
The comedian delivered a hilarious riff about modern technology trends
His spontaneous riff on airline food had everyone laughing loudly

definitions: method of shuffling cards by bending and releasing them to intermix
shallow section of a stream where water flows rapidly over rocks
examples: The dealer performed a perfect riffle to randomize the deck
Learn to riffle properly without damaging the playing cards
We found gold flakes in the riffle below the waterfall
The trout gathered in the riffle to feed on insects

definitions: soldier armed with a rifle, especially one skilled in marksmanship and infantry tactics
examples: The rifleman took position behind cover during the training exercise
Each rifleman carried ammunition and supplies for the three-day mission

definitions: crack, split, or break in rock formations or other solid material
serious disagreement or break in a formerly close relationship between people
examples: Geologists studied the rift valley formed by tectonic plate movement
Water seeped through a small rift in the foundation wall
The political scandal created a rift between longtime coalition partners
Family counseling helped heal the rift between the estranged siblings

definitions: complex arrangement of equipment or machinery for a specific purpose
large offshore structure for drilling oil or gas from ocean floor
large truck, especially one used for hauling freight over long distances
examples: The film crew assembled their camera rig for the action sequence
His gaming rig includes multiple monitors and custom cooling systems
Workers commute by helicopter to the offshore oil rig daily
The drilling rig operates continuously in harsh weather conditions
The driver parked his eighteen-wheel rig at the truck stop
She learned to operate a big rig during trucking school

definitions: person who sets up and maintains rigging for various equipment or structures
worker who handles ropes, cables, and rigging on ships or sailing vessels
examples: The rigger checked all safety cables before the concert began
Experienced riggers assembled the circus tent in just four hours
The ship's rigger repaired damaged sails during the ocean voyage
Maritime riggers must understand complex knot systems and rope handling

definitions: system of ropes, cables, or chains used to support and control equipment
complex arrangement of ropes and chains supporting a ship's masts and sails
examples: Stage rigging must meet strict safety standards for theatrical productions
The construction crew installed rigging to lift steel beams safely
Sailors inspected the rigging before setting out to open sea
Storm damage to the rigging forced them to return to port

definitions: person who supports right-wing or conservative political ideologies and policies
examples: The rightist candidate advocated for traditional values and limited government
Political rightists organized rallies supporting free market economic policies

definitions: quality of being stiff, hard, or unable to bend physically
unwillingness to change or adapt one's thinking, rules, or behavior patterns
examples: The metal's rigidity makes it ideal for structural support beams
Muscle rigidity can indicate certain neurological conditions requiring treatment
The company's rigidity prevented adaptation to changing market conditions
His mental rigidity made compromise impossible during the negotiations

definitions: extremely thorough and careful attention to accuracy and detail in work
harsh or demanding conditions that test endurance, especially cold or difficulty
examples: Scientific research requires rigor in methodology and data analysis
The professor demanded intellectual rigor from all graduate students
Soldiers trained to withstand the rigor of arctic combat conditions
The rigor of pioneer life tested even the strongest settlers

definitions: extremely thorough and careful attention to accuracy and detail in work
harsh or demanding conditions that test endurance, especially cold or difficulty
examples: Academic rigour ensures high standards in university research programs
The investigation proceeded with rigour to uncover all relevant facts
They endured the rigour of mountain climbing in winter conditions
The rigour of military training prepared recruits for combat situations

definitions: outer edge or border of something circular like a wheel or container
metal hoop from which a basketball net hangs on the backboard
examples: The ceramic bowl has a decorative pattern around its rim
Check the rim for damage before mounting the new tire
His shot bounced off the rim and missed the basket
The player dunked forcefully, bending the rim slightly downward

definitions: white frost that forms in freezing fog on surfaces like trees and fences
examples: Beautiful rime covered the pine branches after the freezing fog
The fence posts were decorated with delicate patterns of rime

definitions: thick, tough outer skin of certain fruits or the hard coating on cheese
examples: She grated lemon rind to add flavor to the cake batter
The cheese rind protects the soft interior during the aging process

definitions: person who rings bells, especially church bells in a tower
person or thing that looks exactly like another person or thing
skilled player secretly substituted into a game or competition illegally
examples: The church ringer pulled the ropes every Sunday morning service
Bell ringers practiced complex patterns for the holiday celebration
Your cousin is a dead ringer for that famous movie star
This painting is a ringer for the stolen masterpiece
They accused the team of bringing in a ringer for playoffs
The bowling league banned ringers to keep competition fair

definitions: clear, resonant sound produced by bells or similar metallic objects
quality of being loud, clear, and continuing to resonate
examples: The ringing of church bells announced the wedding ceremony beginning
Constant ringing in her ears required medical evaluation
His ringing endorsement convinced many undecided voters to support her
The soprano's ringing high notes filled the entire concert hall

definitions: person who leads or organizes a group in illegal activities or rebellious behavior
examples: Police identified the ringleader of the smuggling operation after months
The ringleader convinced others to join the prison escape attempt

definitions: person who introduces acts and directs performances in a circus ring
examples: The ringmaster wore a red coat and top hat traditionally
Children watched excitedly as the ringmaster announced each circus act

definitions: area immediately beside a boxing or wrestling ring
position very close to an event providing the best possible view
examples: VIP guests sat at ringside tables during the championship fight
The ringside physician examined the boxer between rounds carefully
We had ringside seats for the political debate last night
Reporters enjoyed ringside access to the celebrity wedding ceremony

definitions: smooth ice surface prepared for skating, hockey, or curling
building or enclosed area containing an ice surface for skating
examples: The hockey team practiced drills on the freshly resurfaced rink
Children learned figure skating on the outdoor rink each winter
The new rink features modern facilities and comfortable spectator seating
Our local rink hosts public skating sessions every weekend afternoon

definitions: act of washing something lightly with water to remove soap or dirt
liquid product applied to hair temporarily for color or conditioning
examples: Give the dishes a quick rinse before putting them away
The final rinse removes all detergent residue from the clothes
The stylist applied a color rinse to enhance her natural highlights
This conditioning rinse helps prevent tangles and adds shine

definitions: violent public disorder involving a group of people causing damage and disruption
examples: The rioting lasted three days before police restored order completely
Widespread rioting erupted after the controversial court verdict was announced

definitions: cord pulled to open a parachute during skydiving or emergency ejection
cord or handle that activates an emergency release mechanism
examples: The skydiver pulled the ripcord at the proper altitude safely
Always check your ripcord placement before jumping from the plane
The pilot yanked the ripcord to deploy the emergency life raft
This ripcord releases the cargo door in emergency situations only

definitions: natural process by which fruit becomes mature, sweet, and ready to eat
examples: The ripening of tomatoes continues even after picking from vines
Proper temperature control ensures even ripening of harvested bananas

definitions: tool or machine designed to tear or cut through material forcefully
person who murders violently, especially referring to serial killers
examples: The seam ripper helps remove stitches without damaging the fabric
Construction crews used a pavement ripper to break up concrete
Jack the Ripper terrorized London during the late nineteenth century
The documentary examined the psychology of notorious rippers throughout history

definitions: small wave or series of waves on water's surface
gradually spreading effect or consequence of an event or action
examples: A gentle ripple spread across the pond from the fallen leaf
Wind created ripples on the previously calm lake surface
The economic policy created a ripple throughout global markets immediately
Her innovative research sent ripples through the scientific community worldwide

definitions: continuous formation of small waves moving across a surface
visible wavelike movement of muscles under skin during flexing
examples: Sunlight danced on the rippling surface of the swimming pool
The rippling water reflected the clouds passing overhead beautifully
His rippling muscles impressed the fitness competition judges significantly
The horse's rippling flanks showed its excellent physical condition

definitions: strong surface current flowing away from shore that can pull swimmers out to sea
examples: Lifeguards warned swimmers about the dangerous riptide near the pier
If caught in a riptide, swim parallel to shore until free

definitions: vertical part of a step between one tread and the next
person who gets up early in the morning habitually
vertical pipe carrying fluids upward in a building system
examples: Each riser must be exactly the same height for safety
The carpenter measured the riser before cutting the stair stringers
As an early riser, she enjoyed quiet morning hours alone
Natural risers often accomplish more before noon than others
The plumber replaced the corroded riser in the heating system
Water flows through the riser to reach upper floor apartments

definitions: act or process of moving upward or increasing in level
organized rebellion or revolt against authority or government
examples: The rising of the sun painted the sky in brilliant colors
Economic indicators show costs rising faster than wages currently
The peasant rising of 1381 changed English society significantly
Military forces suppressed the rising before it spread nationwide

definitions: formal religious or solemn ceremony performed according to prescribed order
examples: The wedding rite included traditional vows and ring exchange
Ancient burial rites reveal much about past civilizations' beliefs

definitions: state of competing with someone for the same objective or superiority
examples: The rivalry between the two schools intensified during basketball season
Sibling rivalry often decreases as children mature into adulthood

definitions: sloping land along the edge of a river where land meets water
examples: Wildflowers bloomed along the riverbank throughout the spring season
Erosion threatened several homes built too close to the riverbank

definitions: bottom of a river channel where water normally flows or has flowed
examples: The dry riverbed revealed fossils from prehistoric marine life
Heavy rains filled the empty riverbed within just three hours
